column3: str

Seigetsu the Enlightened means to return the Dotharl's kindness.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
Speak with the Namazu culinarian.
Deliver the requested supplies to the Namazu culinarian.
Report to Seigetsu the Enlightened.
Speak with the Namazu culinarian.

<SheetEn(Item,1,IntegerParameter(5),1,1)/> at Dotharl Khaa<Else/>Deliver <SheetEn(Item,2,IntegerParameter(5),1,1)/> to the Namazu culinarian</If><Else/></If></If></If></If></If></If></If></If></If></If></If>.
Report to Seigetsu the Enlightened.

The Dotharl have been so very generous in educating us in the ways of archery, I thought it only natural that we repay them somehow. Thus, did I seek out our most skilled chef to prepare an assortment of delicious delights in their honor.

Yes, there is no denying his culinary prowess, so long as he has an assistant to keep him on course, at least. On his own, well...if he were <Switch(PlayerParameter(71))><Case(1)>a Hyur</Case><Case(2)>an Elezen</Case><Case(3)>a Lalafell</Case><Case(4)>a Miqo'te</Case><Case(5)>a Roegadyn</Case><Case(6)>an Au Ra</Case><Case(7)>a Hrothgar</Case><Case(8)>a Viera</Case></Switch> like you I would say he's all thumbs.
He's presently at Nhaama's Retreat gathering ingredients. It would put my mind at ease to know you were there to help him.
Sent by Seigetsu, you say? Oh, thank the heavens. I've made a complete hash of things, and not the delicious sort. No, no.
I somehow managed to ruin my favorite cooking knife. The blade is broken─split cleanly in two. Could you fashion another? Please, please? This crate here should have what you need.

I somehow managed to ruin my favorite cooking knife. The handle simply snapped off while I was mincing some herbs. Could you fashion another? Please, please? This crate here should have what you need.

I somehow managed to ruin my favorite cooking knife. The handle's fallen off, and I need something to stick it back together. I don't suppose you could create an adhesive? Please, please? This crate should have what you need to see the job done.

My cooking knife has grown rather dull, fairly blunt, and I cannot find my whetstone. I would be ever so grateful if you could procure another. The mineral deposits south of Reunion are like to have something I can use.
In my haste to gather ingredients, I've misplaced one of my steppe fruit. Would you procure another for me? Please, please? You'll find them growing in abundance south of Reunion.
In my haste to gather ingredients, I've misplaced my trout. Would you fish up another for me? Please, please. With a bit of salmon roe you'll have them biting in no time at the pond in Dotharl Khaa.
If there's anything else you need─anything at all─don't hesitate to ask. I'll be here gathering more herbs for our tribute to the Dotharl.
This crate here is teeming with supplies. You're certain to find what you need inside.
This crate here is teeming with supplies. You're certain to find what you need inside.
This crate here is teeming with supplies. You're certain to find what you need inside.
The crate appears to be filled to the brim with sundry materials─none of which you require at this time.
The crate appears to be filled to the brim with sundry materials─none of which you require at this time.
The crate appears to be filled to the brim with sundry materials─none of which you require at this time.
The crate appears to be filled to the brim with sundry materials─none of which you require at this time.
You sift through the cornucopia of crafting materials and retrieve all you require for your work.
You sift through the cornucopia of crafting materials and retrieve all you require for your work.
You sift through the cornucopia of crafting materials and retrieve all you require for your work.
I'm sure any whetstone you find south of Reunion will be fine. Yes, yes.
I'm sure any steppe fruit south of Reunion will serve nicely. Yes, yes.
I'm sure any trout you fish up at Dotharl Khaa will serve nicely. Yes, yes.
I imagine I'll have gathered enough herbs here by the time you finish. Do try not to take too long, though.
Oh, yes, yes! This is perfect. Exactly what I needed. At last I can finish my work.
I've created several original dishes specifically for this occasion. Hopefully they prove to the Dotharl's liking.
The Dotharl were quite taken with my cooking last time, delighted by its myriad flavors. I'm sure they'll love my next culinary creation!
Tell Seigetsu to expect a dish worthy of the Big One himself. Yes, yes.
Thank you again for your help, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>sir</If>. Tell Seigetsu I won't be much longer.
Welcome back, friend. How fares our chef?
Did he now? Thankfully my surpassing foresight was able to lead you to him in his hour of need.
The Dotharl are like to experience a meal unlike any other. Assuming, of course, the chef doesn't literally throw himself into his work.
<sigh> To think I ever wondered why my kin have had such trouble mastering the bow.
At our present pace, I daresay we'll be keeping the Dotharls' bellies full for quite some time. Should our chef be beset by troubles again, I hope we can count on your help.
Normal-quality items crafted in the course of this quest serve no purpose and cannot be sold. It is recommended that you discard them.
Normal-quality items gathered in the course of this quest serve no purpose and cannot be sold. It is recommended that you discard them.
